page.title: 04LANDSCAPE OF HENLLAN (2)
page.content:
The limestone area in the east & north east is characterised by a lack of surface drainage.There is however evidence of a considerable underground cave drainage system The main sink for the system is in the south of the block at 039669 whilst the resurgence is 3.5 Km to the north, outside the block.
The consequence of this underground system was recently in evidence in Henllan. In 1983 a bungalow on the Glasfryn estate, which had been built in 1977 had suffered serious cracks in its walls and collapse of ceilings probably as a result of the collapse of part of the underground cavern.
